datafield.subfield: Respondent of 1664 Tübingen diss., for receipt of M.D. May also be praeses of 1672 and 1685 Tübingen dissertations. 1608-1624 imprints are by another of the same name (Mögling or Moegling). Most sources do not distinguish between them. However, Adelung (C.G. Adelung, Fortz. u. Ergänz. Jöchers Allgem. Gelehrt.-Lex.) records a Jo. Ludwig Moegling, b. Tübingen 1613, received M.D. degree Univ. Tübingen, 1640, Prof. Math., Naturwissensch., Arznei., Tübingen, 1660, and Ordentl. Prof. Arznei., 1687; d. 1693, author of Palingenesia, 1683. He is probably the praeses of the 1662 Tübingen diss., De mundo, listed in Heffter. It is not possible to determine whether he or the J.L.M. who received his medical degree in 1664 is the praeses of the dissertations Vigilia (Tübingen, 1672) and Exercit. physica de inferno natural. (Tübingen, 1685).
Brotbeck, J.C. Disp. inaug. med. de podagra, 1664:
t.p. (Joh. Ludovicus Möglingus, T.; received M.D. degree, 1664)
(Moegling, Johann Ludwig; publications, 1665 and 1683; 1617 and 1619 publs.listed under this name are by another J.L. Moegling)
t.p.(... Johann-Ludovico Möglingo, philos. et med. doct., phys. et math. P.P., praeses, Univ. Tübingen, 1672)
His Exercitat. physice de inferno natural., 1685:
t.p. (... Johanne Ludovico Möglingo, phil. & med. doct. experientissimo, physices & mathemat. prof., praeses, Univ. Tübingen, 1685)
NUC; ICSGO; Kestner; Hirsch; Jöcher; Adelung; BN; Heffter.
